reviews.review_msg: best professor in my undergraduate years. Care about studetns.

Dr. Sun's intelligence is inspiring, her lectures are captivating, and she is caring. Her assignments are tough sometimes, but she's always accessible via email, during office hours, or after class. 418 is a tricky course, so be ready to review MATH251&MATH310. She doesn't post lecture notes, but this was an incentive to pay attention in class.

Dr. Sun not only exhibits an excellent attitude towards students in class and is equally affable in office hours, she also teaches with demonstrated understanding and genuineity that is nearly impossible to find in school nowadays. Great prof!

Never choose his course. His homework is disgusting. And his lecture cannot provide enough information to do his homework. He trys to make some bad jokes, but no one cares. The words he use art ambiguous.

If you've struggled with math classes before do not take this prof. He will not tolerate questions covered weeks ago, or from previous classes. If you want to learn, and engage with math at a level unlike other profs, take him.
Far better at teaching pure math than he is at teaching numerical analysis.
okay prof. Assignments took time and were not easy. Exams are fair if you study hard.

He's one of the most enthusiastic and engaging instructors on campus, at a math course no less. Not much proof or analysis is needed as a prereq (but recommended), and the midterms and final questions are all very standard and from the textbook.

One of the few profs that can teach in an *intuitive* manner. He doesn't care about the details, but gives you the big picture of formulae/expressions, which I think is nice. For those who like the have fun in interesting math, take his course.

Well, for first he follows the book word by word, which makes you doubt its woth the time going to class. But what I don't like about him is how he seems to choose homework: it's brutal, both the amount and the actual problems, he doesn't bother to solve any himself. But midterm was a piece of cake!
one of the best teacher in SFU math dept. His explanation is very clear. but don't miss his class otherwise you will get a low mark in his course.
